word_forms.definition_en: made of a type of material that can be shaped into countless forms

examples.example: You should never put hot drinking water into plastic bottles or cups.
examples.translate: 你絕對不可以將熱開水放到塑膠瓶或塑膠杯裡。

examples.example: In the old days, many toys were made of wood or metal, but now most of them are made of plastic.
examples.translate: 在以前，許多玩具都由木頭或金屬所製成，但是現在大部分玩具都是塑膠製的。

word_forms.definition_en: the condition of being useful, easy, or suitable for people

examples.example: Many shops post their business hours on their Facebook pages for the convenience of the public.
examples.translate: 為了大眾方便，許多商店會將它們的營業時間張貼在它們的臉書頁面上。

word_forms.definition_en: in a way that shows excitement about something that will soon happen

examples.example: Rick is eagerly waiting for his boss to post the summer work schedule because he wants to plan his vacation.
examples.translate: Rick渴望地等待他的老闆張貼夏季的工作時間表，因為他想要計畫他的假期。

examples.example: After John sent the romantic email to his girlfriend, he was eager for her reply.
examples.translate: 在John寄出給他女朋友的浪漫電子郵件後，他渴望著她的回覆。

word_forms.definition_en: to be or go totally around something or someone

examples.example: The house is surrounded by tall trees, so nobody can see it from the road.
examples.translate: 那棟房子被高聳的樹所圍繞，所以沒有人能從馬路上看到它。

examples.example: The hotel is in beautiful natural surroundings far away from the city.
examples.translate: 這間旅館位在遠離城市的美麗自然環境中。

word_forms.definition_en: to move in a certain direction smoothly and slowly, usually on water or in the air

examples.example: After the captain fell asleep, the ship passed the harbor and then drifted toward the middle of the sea.
examples.translate: 在船長睡著之後，這艘船越過港口接著漂向海中央。

word_forms.definition_en: to desire the same qualities, possessions, opportunities, etc. that someone else has

examples.example: Christopher really envies his best friend, Patty, because she has been to so many countries.
examples.translate: Christopher真的很羨慕他最好的朋友Patty，因為她已經去過非常多國家。

examples.example: Kyle looked with envy at his friend’s smartphone since it was much newer and better than his.
examples.translate: Kyle羨慕地看著他朋友的智慧型手機，因為比他的手機更新更好。

word_forms.definition_en: filled with things or people

examples.example: The Smith family is moving into a new house tomorrow, so their living room is crowded with boxes.
examples.translate: Smith一家人將在明天搬入新家，所以他們的客廳擠滿了箱子。

examples.example: The singer performed her three newest songs in front of a crowd of excited fans.
examples.translate: 這位歌手在一群興奮的歌迷面前表演三首她最新的歌曲。

word_forms.definition_en: used to indicate that something is very easy to see or understand

examples.example: The little girl is wearing yellow shoes, a yellow dress, and has painted her nails yellow. Obviously, she likes this color.
examples.translate: 這個小女孩正穿著黃色的鞋子跟黃色的洋裝，而且還把她的指甲塗成黃色。顯然她喜歡這個顏色。

examples.example: It was quite obvious to Carrie’s friends that she was in love with Mike because she couldn’t stop talking about him.
examples.translate: Carrie愛上Mike這件事對她的朋友來說是相當明顯的，因為她總是談論到他。

word_forms.definition_en: something that is grown or produced, and usually sold

examples.example: This shop sells a variety of health and food products for babies.
examples.translate: 這家商店販售各式各樣的嬰兒專用的健康產品和食品。

examples.example: This company produces more computers than any other company in the world.
examples.translate: 這家公司比世界上任何其他公司所製造的電腦都還要多。

examples.example: Taiwan is known for the production of high-quality bicycles like those that are made by Giant.
examples.translate: 臺灣以製造高品質腳踏車聞名，像是捷安特所製造的腳踏車。

word_forms.definition_en: to eat or drink something

examples.example: Driving after you consume too much beer or wine can lead to a car crash.
examples.translate: 飲用太多啤酒或葡萄酒後開車可能會造成車禍。

examples.example: Finishing his assignments consumes most of Riley’s free time in the evening and on the weekend.
examples.translate: 完成作業耗掉Riley大部分傍晚和週末的空閒時間。

examples.example: The study found that our city is the largest consumer of water in the country.
examples.translate: 這份研究發現我們是國內耗水量最大的城市。

word_forms.definition_en: able to make a person or animal die or become ill if consumed or entering the body

examples.example: Chocolate is delicious for most people, but did you know that it can be poisonous to dogs?
examples.translate: 巧克力對大部分的人來說很美味，但是你知道對狗來說它可能是有毒的嗎？

examples.example: Andy tried to poison the cockroaches in his apartment with a chemical he bought at the store, but it didn’t work.
examples.translate: Andy試著用他從商店買來的化學藥劑來毒死公寓裡的蟑螂，但沒有效。

examples.example: Nobody except for the scientists is allowed to enter the testing room because there are several deadly poisons in there.
examples.translate: 除了那些科學家以外，沒有人被允許進入試驗室，因為裡面有幾種致命的毒藥。

examples.example: The rock star almost died after he took poison by mistake; he thought it was a soft drink.
examples.translate: 那位搖滾歌手錯喝毒藥後差點喪命；他以為那是汽水。

word_forms.definition_en: a kind of solid, liquid, or gas that has certain qualities

examples.example: The police found a chemical substance at the murder scene and are doing tests on it right now.
examples.translate: 警方在謀殺現場發現一種化學物質，現在正在對它進行檢驗。

word_forms.definition_en: a process of treating used items such as plastic, metal, glass, etc. so that they can be used again

examples.example: After the party, Nick took all the empty bottles out for recycling.
examples.translate: 派對過後，Nick把所有空瓶子拿到外面回收。

examples.example: Many people don’t realize that about 75% of the waste they produce can be recycled.
examples.translate: 許多人不了解他們製造的廢棄物約有百分之七十五可以被回收。

word_forms.definition_en: damage or injury

examples.example: The cleaners were careful not to do any harm to the objects in the museum as they cleaned around them.
examples.translate: 在清潔的時候，那些清潔工很小心避免損傷博物館裡的物品。

examples.example: Rebecca put the puppy down carefully in order not to harm it.
examples.translate: Rebecca小心翼翼地將小狗放下以免傷害到牠。

examples.example: Looking at the sun for too long is harmful to your eyes.
examples.translate: 直視太陽太久會對你的眼睛有害。

word_forms.definition_en: the natural world in which living things exist

examples.example: It is every person’s responsibility to save the earth’s natural environment for our sons and daughters.
examples.translate: 為我們未來的子女拯救地球的自然環境是每一個人的責任。

examples.example: All company owners should create a safe working environment for their employees.
examples.translate: 所有企業主應該為他們的員工創造一個安全的工作環境。

examples.example: Environment plays a key role in the way humans develop and learn new things.
examples.translate: 環境在人類如何發展及學習新事物上扮演一個關鍵的角色。

examples.example: The president’s speech to the students will focus on environmental problems such as shrinking forests and climate change.
examples.translate: 總統對那群學生的演講將會著重在像是逐漸縮減的森林和氣候變遷等環境問題。

word_forms.definition_en: in the correct or most suitable manner

examples.example: Marc didn’t complete the assignment properly, so the teacher asked him to do it again.
examples.translate: Marc沒有好好地完成作業，所以老師要求他重做。

examples.example: Silly jokes should only be told at the proper place and time.
examples.translate: 愚蠢的笑話應該在適當的地點跟時間才能說。

word_forms.definition_en: to show up or arrive at a place

examples.example: Jane said she’s not ready to join us yet, but she will come along later.
examples.translate: Jane說她還沒準備好要加入我們，但她待會就會到。

word_forms.definition_en: to put things into a box, piece of luggage, etc. to transport them

examples.example: After Mr. Huang got fired, he sadly packed all of his things up and left.
examples.translate: 在黃先生被解僱之後，他很難過地將他所有的東西打包後離開。

word_forms.definition_en: by oneself

examples.example: Lily loves to go fishing on her own, so she can listen to the sound of the sea.
examples.translate: Lily喜歡獨自去釣魚，這樣她才能聆聽大海的聲音。

word_forms.definition_en: for a (usually short) period of time

examples.example: The lion hid behind a tree for a while, waiting for a deer to walk by.
examples.translate: 那隻獅子躲在樹後一陣子，等著鹿兒經過。

word_forms.definition_en: to be in a certain place, state, or situation after doing something

examples.example: The family couldn’t agree on a restaurant to go to, so they ended up staying home and eating pizza.
examples.translate: 這家人對於去哪家餐廳無法達成共識，所以他們最後就待在家裡吃披薩。
